body:
Post using modlogs: https://ruqqus.com/+HijackedGuilds/post/6370/current-hijack-situation-update-in-hitlerwasright

Cap addressing post using modlogs as evidence: https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/63bl/alt-abuse-and-admin-actions

As far as I am aware, this is the first time the modlogs have been helpful to admin intervention on the site. Modlogs have been used in this instance under public discovery (by me) on finding a per user limit violation concerning an invalid siege (Ruqqus ToS). My discovery lead to admin intervention and the return of +ForbiddenFacts to it's rightful owner.

Great job, making modlogs public, admins! 

It's with your help by providing these vital resources that we have stopped an unfair siege. Holding mods accountable is a great idea, and now we even have proof it's worked!

body:
> unfair siege

How was it unfair? User (according to concurrent interpretation of the TOS) breached TOS and got permanently banned. Guild was sieged as allowed by Ruqqus mechanics given the permanently banned GM. New GM used the powers he lawfully acquired.

body:
The GM who sieged used an alt to circumvent the per user limit set by the 30 day siege cooldown.

The other reason is the guild was returned to the original GM because it was commuted to a tempban.

Modlogs have been used in this instance under public discovery (by me) on finding a per user limit violation concerning an invalid siege (Ruqqus ToS). My discovery lead to admin intervention and the return of +ForbiddenFacts to it's rightful owner.

Great job, making modlogs public, admins!

It's with your help by providing these vital resources that we have stopped an unfair siege. Holding mods accountable is a great idea, and now we even have proof it's worked!

post.body:

Cap addressing post using modlogs as evidence: https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/63bl/alt-abuse-and-admin-actions

As far as I am aware, this is the first time the modlogs have been helpful to admin intervention on the site. My discovery lead to admin intervention and the return of +ForbiddenFacts to it's rightful owner.

Great job, making modlogs public, admins! 

It's with your help by providing these vital resources that we have stopped an unfair siege. Holding mods accountable is a great idea, and now we even have proof it's worked!

body:
> They control the website. I am not appealing to any authority

body:
Well actually it does because JG's ban was commuted to a tempban.

The precedent is any tempbans that reversed lawful sieges resulted in the compensation of users sieging with a reset on their siege cooldown and the reward of 1 coin to the user as compensation.

While I personally would rather not let Carp get a coin out of spite, I'm going to be fair and ping @captainmeta4 to do it.

Case precedent: @klenvastergan entered as perm ban, but was supposed to be a tempban. All users who sieged his guilds had their sieges reversed, reset siege cooldown, and were rewarded 1 coin each.

post.body:
Post using modlogs: https://ruqqus.com/+HijackedGuilds/post/6370/current-hijack-situation-update-in-hitlerwasright

Cap addressing post using modlogs as evidence: https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/63bl/alt-abuse-and-admin-actions

As far as I am aware, this is the first time the modlogs have been helpful to admin intervention on the site. Modlogs have been used in this instance under public discovery (by me) on finding a per user limit violation concerning an invalid siege (Ruqqus ToS). My discovery lead to admin intervention and the return of +ForbiddenFacts to it's rightful owner.

Great job, making modlogs public, admins! 

It's with your help by providing these vital resources that we have stopped an unfair siege. Holding mods accountable is a great idea, and now we even have proof it's worked!

parent.body:
Well actually it does because JG's ban was commuted to a tempban.

The precedent is any tempbans that reversed lawful sieges resulted in the compensation of users sieging with a reset on their siege cooldown and the reward of 1 coin to the user as compensation.

While I personally would rather not let Carp get a coin out of spite, I'm going to be fair and ping @captainmeta4 to do it.

Case precedent: @klenvastergan entered as perm ban, but was supposed to be a tempban. All users who sieged his guilds had their sieges reversed, reset siege cooldown, and were rewarded 1 coin each.

body:
Captainmeta4 gave away that JennaThorne was his alt on Discord. So on Discord, Cyrsz#8901 told me that JennaThorne was banned, I said that I didn't know who JennaThorne was, they told me that it could've been Klenny's alt, I said that that seemed plausible but also unknowable, and then cap confirmed that it was indeed Klenny's alt. (I didn't know back then that Klenny was secretive of his alts.)

Also, I think that the incident where [captainmeta4 gave away Bardfinn's supposed pre-trans name](https://ruqqus.com/+averageredditor/post/4ifs/bardfinn-says-ruqqus-is-an-amplifier/fnsx) is a better indicator of him having double standards in his doxxing rule.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Captainmeta4 gave away that JennaThorne was his alt on Discord. So on Discord, Cyrsz#8901 told me that JennaThorne was banned, I said that I didn't know who JennaThorne was, they told me that it could've been Klenny's alt, I said that that seemed plausible but also unknowable, and then cap confirmed that it was indeed Klenny's alt. (I didn't know back then that Klenny was secretive of his alts.)

Also, I think that the incident where captainmeta4 gave away Bardfinn's supposed pre-trans name is a better indicator of him having double standards in his doxxing rule.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

body:
Crystal?

I'm not as perfect as you think I am. I'm involved in some things due to constantly being online, but I'm certainly not involved in everything, nor am I "perfect at everything". For example, I'm not a part of the RCP either (nor do I want to be). I also haven't been doing as much as I want to due to laziness. You've done things in your life as well, and I certainly don't think that I can do more than you in 2 hours than what you can in your whole life. I don't think that you're ruining the site. Lots of users like your content, and there are certainly users who like you as a person as well (like gaycuttlefish, I think).

If there's something you're interested in that you think you can improve on, pursue that interest. You enjoy it when you accomplish something or improve on a skill, right? Like you said, I think you still have time to turn things around. I don't think you should give up right now just because some people seem to be more talented than you.

<sup> *- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]* </sup>
